id: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Dunedin-310 Princes Street, Central Dunedin, Dunedin 9016-Humanitix
name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Dunedin
description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.
Resilience enables individuals to navigate uncertainty with confidence and adaptability.
This 90-minute workshop delves into the profound significance of resilience, offering participants practical insights and actionable strategies to cultivate resilience and harness the potential of the mind.
By equipping individuals with these tools, the workshop empowers them to not only weather storms but also thrive in dynamic environments.
Sarah is motivated to continue creating positive change and to educate people about the power of the mind and how to use life's challenges as an opportunity for growth.

id: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Queenstown-93 Beach Street, Queenstown 9300-Humanitix
name: Healthy Hospo Building Resilience Queenstown
description:
Why this matters: In our rapidly changing world, resilience emerges as a fundamental skill.

id: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington-13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Gong Bath at Vogelmorn Hall, Wellington
venue: 13 Vennell Street, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
***$20*** Limited door sales for $25 *Please bring a yoga mat, pillow, eye mask and blanket- or whatever it is you need to feel warm and comfortable* Discover the transformative effects of sound therapy with this 1-hour gong bath experience.
During this session, participants will be surrounded by the resonant vibrations of gongs, carefully designed to induce deep states of relaxation and calm.
Scientific studies have highlighted the benefits of sound therapy, particularly gong baths, in reducing stress and promoting overall well-being.
Beyond the immediate effects, many participants report experiencing lasting benefits such as improved sleep, reduced anxiety, and enhanced mood following a gong bath session.
By immersing yourself in the healing vibrations of the gongs, you can tap into a deeper sense of relaxation and rejuvenation.

id: International Packraft Film Festival - Wellington-205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: International Packraft Film Festival - Wellington
venue: 205 Ohiro Road, Brooklyn, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Join PRANZ and Blue Duck Packrafts for the Wellington screening of the International Packrafting Film Festival 2025 What to Expect.... A night of soulful river journeys and epic whitewater.
First descents, big swims, wild country, and quiet moments.
Films by paddlers, for paddlers — with stories that matter.
A chance to connect with the local community and chat with local suppliers.
Spot prizes, chance to network with other adventurers and maybe a few surprises… Grab a drink and some nibbles from the cash bar and meet some fellow adventurers.

id: Author Alley-289 Mazengarb Road, Paraparaumu 5032, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Author Alley
description:
Indulge in a stroll through Bookmark Kāpiti’s very own Author Alley.
Meet local authors, creatives and service providers within the workshop space of Big Mac Slabs, transformed for one day only in a book-lovers market.
Venture down to discover your next great read and make connections with others in the industry.
Come down anytime between 10–3pm.
Stallholders can register interest via our website, click here

id: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells-Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Jazz Orchestra Composer Series Presents: Callum Passells
venue: Level 1/18 Garrett Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
The new pieces commissioned for this series continue to stretch at the fabric of jazz and improvised forms, and are inspired by Morton Feldman, Lennie Tristano, Henry Threadgill and Sly Stone.
Callum has been deeply involved in the New Zealand jazz and improvised music scene for over a decade, and is a busy freelancer in the wider music community in Auckland.
He has performed with Aldous Harding, Hans Pucket, the Exploding Rainbow Orchestra, the Auckland Philharmonia Orchestra, among many others.
In 2021, Callum was commissioned to compose a large-scale work 'Solid Spirit, Liquid Body' for the Wellington Jazz Festival.
The Jazz Orchestra Composer Series showcases original music for large jazz ensemble by New Zealand composers.

id: Make Nice @ Cuba St Tavern-172 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Make Nice @ Cuba St Tavern
venue: 172 Cuba Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description: We’re bringing you the first Wellington instalment of Make Nice After previous parties in the north and south we can confirm it’s a nice time August 16th we’ll be bringing the warmth to Wellingtons heart at the lush Cuba St Tavern Funky beats and deep grooves our focus is the music, movement and how it brings us together Swamp Shack Sound System will be filling the space with quality sound Be yourselves, be kind and let’s make nice

id: Live From The Inferno Release Show (Adult Friends & Kahukuranui)-behind Moon Bar 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Live From The Inferno Release Show (Adult Friends & Kahukuranui)
venue: behind Moon Bar 167 Riddiford Street, Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
description:
Adult Friends are releasing a live EP recorded on Halloween 2024, featuring  Kahukuranui.
To celebrate, we’re throwing a special night at Moon—expect a blazing set from Adult Friends, followed by an immersive journey through hypnotic electronica with Kahukuranui.
Kicking off the night is the heavy shoegaze solo project of Thomas Waddington: The World is Against You.
Don’t miss this unforgettable evening—and your chance to grab a free CD copy of Live From The Inferno by Adult Friends and Kahukuranui.
Be at Moon, Newtown for 8pm doors!

id: Unified Chaos: Student Graduation Showcase-17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Unified Chaos: Student Graduation Showcase
venue: 17b Allen Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
After 8 weeks of structured chaos, it’s time to unleash the weird.
Come see the newest batch of Basejumpers take the improv comedy stage and turn their boldest ideas into spontaneous, joyful, unified nonsense.
Tickets $10 Online sales.
Door sales while available.

id: Diabetes NZ Wellington Youth: Pickleball-72 Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Diabetes NZ Wellington Youth: Pickleball
venue: 72 Kemp Street, Kilbirnie, Wellington 6022, New Zealand
description:
After a successful Pickleball taster earlier in the year, join Diabetes NZ Wellington Youth for an action-packed afternoon of games held in conjunction with Wellington Pickleball.
Pickleball is the fastest growing sport in the world and is accessible for the whole family.
Parents/ caregivers are most welcome to join in on the fun!
Any questions please get in touch with bridgets@diabetes.org.nz.
We are very grateful to have Wellington Pickleball join us again to coach us through and answer any questions on the day.

id: New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony 2025-55-59 Thorndon Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: New Zealand Book Awards for Children & Young Adults Ceremony 2025
venue: 55-59 Thorndon Quay, Pipitea, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Buy your tickets now for the 2025 New Zealand Book Awards for Children and Young Adults to join the celebration of the best books of the year for young New Zealand readers.
You’ll get to meet the finalists and applaud the winners at an exuberant awards ceremony in the characterful Pipitea Marae on Wednesday 13 August.
Their achievements will be acknowledged on the night by publishers, politicians, booksellers, librarians, media and supporters of the children’s literature community.
Members of the public are welcome to purchase tickets too.
This is a popular event with a limited number of seats, so book your place today and enjoy this wonderful celebration of Aotearoa’s very best children’s literature.

id: WISA Bowling Night-234/238 Wakefield Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: WISA Bowling Night
venue: 234/238 Wakefield Street, Te Aro, Wellington 6011, New Zealand
description:
Join the Wellington International Students Association for a night of strikes, spares, and laughs at our Bowling Night!
This is your chance to hang out with international students from all over the world, make new friends, and enjoy have a fun start to your week.
Spaces are limited to just 60 tickets, so grab yours early and don’t miss out!

id: Communication Opportunities Throughout the Day, Part 2 - Got a device, now what? Blenheim-Whitney Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand-Humanitix
name: Communication Opportunities Throughout the Day, Part 2 - Got a device, now what? Blenheim
venue: Whitney Street, Blenheim Central, Blenheim 7201, New Zealand
description:
Following on from the success of Communication Opportunities throughout the day, we have listened to the feedback from participants and are pleased to bring you Part 2 - Got a device, now what Have you recently had a communication device issued to you and you would like support getting it up and running?
A practical one-day workshop for teachers, teacher aides, whānau, health professionals and other interested people.
Lots of practical tools, resources, tips and tricks will be shared.
Group discounts for 10 or more people from the same organisation are available, please email courses@talklink.org.nz to arrange.
Venue will be central Blenheim.
